name: Sheraton Baltimore City Center Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed at the Sheraton City Center for a wedding. I had a great time. I was able to check in at 10:00 am with no problems. They had no problems with bringing my dog. I was able to walk her around the hotel with no problems. The room was very clean. The beds were VERY comfortable. Bathroom was clean. When I checked in they gave me a ticket for a care package to be sent up to my room because of the construction on my tower. The package was great. We ordered room service for dinner and breakfast and had no problems. Would definately stay here again and would recommend to others.
reviews.title: No problems

reviews.text: I stayed here last week (Aug. 07). I was lucky enough to be in the North Tower. I have to say the room was very nice. Obviously, you get the comfortable bed. But my room was very attractive, with new furniture and a most excellent flat screen TV mounted on the wall! Shula's was closed for renovations, but the sports bar was open and the 2 lunch sandwiches I had there were great (and reasonable by downtown/big city prices). The lobby was always extremely crowded (we had at least one covention, and a huge family reunion). Do take note about the sketchy location. It's a 4 block walk to the convention center, and a good little walk to Inner Harbor. The surrounding area is hit and miss, and you do NOT want to make a wrong turn. I'd suggest a cab in the evenings, even short distances.
reviews.title: OK, let's mention the NORTH Tower

reviews.text: in all, I believe once the South Tower gets renovated, this will be a nice hotel.
reviews.title: Needs a lot of improvement

reviews.text: This Sheraton is under going renovations. There are two towers a north and south. The north is is much better shape. Our 1st room in the south tower had no dresser, the frame for the closet was wallpapered over, the toilet seat was haning off and this was one of the rooms which was just redone. Friends had another south tower room and were never told that they would not have any water from 10am till 3 pm everyday during their stay. We were moved to the north tower and was much better. After many discussions with the manager we were given free breakfast buffet which was in Shula's resturant in the hotel. Breakfast was a lot to be desired. Want a huge breakfast, walk down the street to the Days Inn right across the street from the convention center. Shula's is estremely expensive and the service is very very slow. We waited 40 minutes just to get menus to our table. Only reason we stayed was to see how long it would actually take. Travelocity was contacted and stated that they were sending a team down to investigate. They never notified us that the hotel was undergoing renovations. The pool was just opened that day so the water was quite cold but we were thankful it was open.
reviews.title: Is that blood on the door, or...?

likes.disliked: — Horrible room conditions in the south tower.

reviews.text: NOTICE: This is an OK hotel, as long as your room is in the north tower!!!
reviews.title: Why are you complaining?

likes.liked: — Limo service, restaurant, TV, bed, decor

reviews.text: Aside from this hotel being located in Baltimore (yikes!) this hotel is just ok. Apparently the north tower was recently remodled and has more of a Sheraton feel but there is still no wireless internet, no bathtubs and the location doesn't feel safe at night. The south tower is run down and dirty - don't stay there. I thought the hotel staff service was pretty good though.
reviews.title: Stay in the NORTH tower
One Slight Problem
reviews.text: The hotel rooms were very nice once you got in. It is a little bit of a hike to the inner harbor. The place was nice except we had one problem. After we got home, I checked my Discover Card and there were a few charges on there that I didn't make. They weren't big amounts however I was charged for lunch at Shula's restaurant, then there was also another charge for something else. I called the hotel immediantly and apparently the next person who had our room was charging things to the room. The hotel never took off my credit card from the room. Luckily, Discover resolved this. I felt when I called the hotel to tell them I never ate at these restaurants they were slightly rude- especially since it was there mistake!

This is the WORST hotel experience I have ever had. Not only did they conveniently "forget" about the agreed-upon rate of reservation upon check-in, but the rooms were NOT CLEANED when we went in--disgusting! To add to that, the staff sent to fix the room took their time arriving and were incredibly rude. The hotel didn't do anything to compensate for the mess that they left, and the rooms themselves were hardly anything special - small, cramped, and with few amenities. You'd think a hotel would have the customer in mind rather than the bottom line, but sadly this is not the case. I thought Sheratons were supposed to be quality, but it looks like the name doesn't carry the weight it used to. Would give no stars if I could -- AVOID.
reviews.title: The dirtiest hotel in Baltimore

likes.liked: — It was close to the city center

reviews.text: We just returned from a wonderful weekend at The Sheraton Baltimore City Center Hotel in Baltimore Maryland. We have been to the Inner Harbor Area before to see a baseball game 2 years ago and said that this time we would like to stay at the Inner Harbor. After searching through many hotels and getting discouraged by the ridiculously high prices some of the hotels were asking I recieved an e-mail from the Sheraton and figured from their reputation that we couldn't go wrong. After reading some of the reviews I must say I was concerned that maybe this experience would be different. Everything was just fine and then some. Parking was nearby (across the street @ $18 per day) and convenient. Check-in was efficient. We requested 2 rooms in the North Tower that were ajoining which was honored. The room was more than adequate. It was new and clean with a nice flat screen T.V. and a nice view of the pool below. The location although not directly on the Inner Harbor was good and as long as you stick to the main roads for ultimate security there is no problem. Chambermaids and Bell staff were friendly and helpful and check-out was effortless. Our bill was under the door the morning of our departure with an additional memo concerning the high volume of check-outs to be expected that day because of the Ballgame and Jazz festival . An explanation of special provisions to be made for luggage storage of patrons checking out that would be attending the game that day were included. I was impressed to say the least. I would certainly stay again.
reviews.title: Good Experience

reviews.text: The excellent staff at this hotel have to be applauded for keeping things together at this Sheraton which is undergoing renovations. The North Tower is fine, but the South Tower is dirty and untidy. Our South Tower room was unlike anything I've ever seen even in a one star hotel (curtains turned black with soot, black ceiling, chipped and cracked paint, beds separated from headboard, dirty carpet, walls, bathroom, the list goes on...) Staff kindly moved us to the north tower and guest services clerk gave us a handwritten note to apologize and gave us a breakfast voucher for Shula's.
reviews.title: Excellent staff but much more needed
